alert.note: Alert for Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 11:12AM PST until January 14 at 10:12AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oregon, including the following counties, Curry and far western Josephine. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Streams will continue to rise into tonight due to rainfall and excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1104 AM PST, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. Between 2 and 5.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. The Chetco River at Brookings is expected to rise rapidly this afternoon and evening. A forecast peak of 22.7 feet would be around the historical peaks of 22.2 feet on 1/19/2012 and 22.98 feet on 11/20/2012. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brookings, Alfred A. Loeb State Park, Agness, Briggs Creek Recreation Site, Harbor, Pistol River, Harris Beach State Park, Ophir and Nesika Beach. Also, the northern portions of the Smith River Complex Burn Scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
